description: Mapping from Notability notation to LaTeX commands for Isaiah study notes

highlights.note: Highlight colors are mostly random for marking repeated words or thematic connections. No fixed color-to-meaning mapping.

red_circle.description: Indicates literary/chiastic structure. Red circles mark the structural elements (A, B, C, A', B', etc.). Indentation indicates depth. Primes (') indicate corresponding elements.

blue_circle.indicator: Text circled in blue (with optional title nearby)
blue_circle.description: Marks general notes and commentary sections. Blue circles indicate content that needs LaTeX formatting. Optional blue title text provides the section header.

overview.description: Chapter overview sections. Indentation level maps to \overviewsection[level] parameter.

black_star.typical_use: All footnotes - placed by word and by corresponding note
black_star.description: Single marker type for all footnote content (translation alternatives, cross-references, Hebrew/Greek explanations, scholarly citations)

purple_circle.description: Marks images that need to be added to the LaTeX document. Look for nearby labels/captions to determine image context.

components.definition: Theological or contextual meaning (can be empty {})

format_rules: Quote text in italics with proper quotation marks
Use \\\\ for paragraph breaks within quotes

verse_formatting.description: Poetry-style verse layout with consistent indentation

commentary_sections.placement: Between biblical outline sections or after related verses
typical_titles: God has no compassion on Poor?

document_structure.description: Standard document structure for chapter files

conversion_hints.blue_circles: Blue circles mark general notes/commentary - look for nearby blue title text for section headers
conversion_hints.red_circles: Red circles mark literary structure - indicates chiastic or outline structure
conversion_hints.purple_circles: Purple circles mark images to be added - look for nearby labels/captions
conversion_hints.black_stars: Small black stars (★) mark footnotes - one star by the word, one star by the corresponding note
conversion_hints.highlights: Random colors mark repeated words or thematic connections - don't assume fixed meaning per color
conversion_hints.verse_ranges: Always look for verse numbers and ranges (e.g., '8-12', 'v.13', 'vv. 18-21')
conversion_hints.theme_detection: Section headers typically follow pattern 'Verses X-Y: Theme Description'
conversion_hints.indentation: Visual indentation in notes maps to chiastic depth or outline level
